content: Blogger in Singapore **Chubby Hubby** or **Aun Koh** (born 1972) is a Singaporean blogger. His blog consists of dining reviews, [travelling](/wiki/Travel), [wine](/wiki/Wine) and [recipes](/wiki/Recipes) for [baking](/wiki/Baking) and [cooking](/wiki/Cooking). It also consists of many [photographs](/wiki/Photograph) of the food, most being [digitally altered](/wiki/Photo_manipulation). The blog earned reviews in the *[Guardian](/wiki/The_Guardian)* and was nominated for the world's best urban food blog in the 2005 Urban Blogging Awards. ## Career Koh graduated from [Columbia College](/wiki/Columbia_College_(New_York)) of [Columbia University](/wiki/Columbia_University) in 1996. He was mentioned in [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore) [Lee Hsien Loong](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Loong)'s [National Day Rally](/wiki/National_Day_Rally) speech in 2006, as an example of Singaporean blogs on the [internet](/wiki/Internet). Singapore newspaper *[The Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times)* has mentioned him several times in articles about the hottest blogs, blogs to watch and the most popular food blogs. He was interviewed by *[Newsweek](/wiki/Newsweek)* and mentioned in *[The New York Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times),* the *[South China Morning Post](/wiki/South_China_Morning_Post)* and [The Guardian](/wiki/The_Guardian). Koh was invited to dine during the finale recording of Bravo Channels 8th Season's Top Chef competition 2010; which was held in Singapore; the shows first international finale location. Koh was not a judge but was a dinner guest. In 2018, Koh and Wee Teng Wen, managing director of The Lo & Behold Group, opened a private club, Straits Clan, on the site of the former [New Majestic hotel](/wiki/New_Majestic_Hotel) in [Bukit Pasoh Road](/wiki/Bukit_Pasoh_Road). In 2021, the club was fully acquired by the Mandala Group and renamed as the Mandala Club. ## Personal life Koh's father is [Tommy Koh](/wiki/Tommy_Koh), a Singaporean diplomat, lawyer, professor and author who served as [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)'s [Permanent Representative to the United Nations](/wiki/Permanent_Representative_to_the_United_Nations). His brother is [Wei Koh](/wiki/Wei_Koh), founder of Revolution Magazine and [The Rake](/wiki/The_Rake). Koh is married to Tan Su-Lyn, an editor and they have two children. - Official website This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Chubby Hubby
